DOCNAME: CASE OF KLIMENKO AND OSTAPENKO v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE and the second applicant in DATE . They live in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants , GPE victims , were in receipt of a DATE pension and a special “ food allowance ” from the ORG . They brought proceedings against the regional social security office ( “ the defendant ” ) claiming recalculation of the pension and the allowance in line with the increase of the minimum subsistence amount .

CARDINAL . On the dates listed below ORG of GPE granted the applicants’ claims and ordered the increase of the allowance and its subsequent index - linking . In re - calculating the amounts to be paid the court applied the multiplier of CARDINAL reflecting the increase of the minimal subsistence amount in GPE . The judgments acquired legal force , as upheld on DATE by ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant appealed to ORG by way of supervisory review of the judgments .

CARDINAL . On DATE the judge rapporteur refused to initiate the supervisory review proceedings and to remit either of the CARDINAL cases for examination on the merits to the Presidium of ORG ( “ the GPE defendant complained to the President of ORG about the judgments in the applicants’ favour and the judge rapporteur ’s decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of the Rostov ORG and on DATE judge B. of ORG allowed the defendant authority ’s applications for supervisory review of the judgments in the first and the second applicants’ favour respectively and sent the cases for examination on the merits to the ORG . These decisions referred to the arguments adduced by the defendant but offered no explanation as to the grounds for overruling the judge rapporteur ’s decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On the dates listed in the Appendix the ORG , by way of supervisory review , quashed the first instance and the appeal judgments on the ground that that the lower courts had applied an incorrect multiplier to the applicants’ cases , and remitted the cases for a fresh examination to the first instance court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the cases anew . The court , by a single judgment , established that the allowance due to the applicants should have been multiplied by CARDINAL in DATE and by CARDINAL for DATE . The court restored in the favour of each applicant MONEY ( RUB ) for the period DATE and DATE and established that as of DATE they were entitled to the DATE compensation in the amount of RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL , to be index - linked in future . The judgment was not appealed against and became final DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE the second applicant brought further court proceedings for adjustment of the allowance . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG granted his claims and ordered the allowance to be increased by application of the multipliers of CARDINAL and CARDINAL respectively and to pay him arrears for the periods from DATE and from DATE to DATE .

CARDINAL . As follows from the Government ’s additional observations , on DATE the second applicant applied for annulment of these CARDINAL judgments and the award of DATE due to discovery of new circumstances . On DATE the request was granted by an unspecified court . The judgments of DATE , DATE and DATE were annulled on account of discovery of unspecified new circumstances , and the cases were remitted for a new examination .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , on CARDINAL DATE ORG recovered in the second applicant ’s favour RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL of unpaid allowance in respect of the period from DATE to DATE and ordered further increase of the DATE payments up to RUB CARDINAL . The scope of the applicant ’s claims was not specified by the Government and it is unclear whether these claims had been granted in full or in part . The judgment entered into force on DATE and at some point was executed in full .

CARDINAL . The parties did not submit copies of the judgments of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE , the second applicant ’s statement of claims in the respective proceedings and his application dated DATE for annulment of the earlier judgments .

CARDINAL . For the relevant provisions on the supervisory - review proceedings contained in LAW see the ORG ’s judgment in the case of PERSON and Others v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL et seq . , § CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE ) .
